title: Is lcs boring as sh*t to anyone else too ?
body:
Same old broken champs, almost same team comps every game, nothing innovative. Just copying korean shit. Farming for 20 mins, cuz dmg is so high and everyone playing so safe, etc...
Only thing it does if I'm doing something else to have it in other tab for the noise.

But...the whole purpose of the LCS is to entertain mate...

Each year, it's always a Korean team taking the championship and I just don't have an invested interest in foreign teams.

NA teams don't usually make it far in worlds and they've never taken first place ever.

So...I don't have a reason to pay any attention to the LCS scene.

Also, at risk of going a little off topic, I hate how players try modeling everything they pick and buid off LCS without any kind of inkling as to WHY those things were done in LCS in the first place. And I'm told, "trust, it's op" every time I voice my doubts. And then it's gg for me because bronze and silver players just try playing copy pasta and ultimately fail at it.

NA and EU actually looked fairly strong this previous worlds.  Misfits were one failed Tower dive away from beating SKT 3-1, but they (seemingly) let their nerves get the better of them.  I think the West has a decent chance this year as long as team quality doesn't completely tank.
It has always been boring and lame
esports has been killing this game since it started.

I won't lie, the {{champion:6}} {{champion:83}} {{champion:67}} were surprisingly fun to watch, yet seriously depressing as their 100% loserate just shows how self-centered & narrow the LCS champion pools are, mostly due to Riot refusing to nerf them.

I mean, where's the long demanded {{champion:29}} {{champion:18}} {{champion:96}} nerfs we asked ever since Worlds ended??

I find it exciting. At least watching the "lower tier" teams. 

Watching Flyquest beat TSM yesterday was awesome, why? Because Flyquest was aggressive, they saw an opportunity and took it. They didn't play the passive no fight game that "top tier" teams like TSM and SKT did. All SKT games in world's were boring... SKT would farm for 40 minutes, win one team fight then end.

Valkrin's commentary on itemization during the live game was entertaining.

TSM tilted him lol.

The commentary is always amazing lol. 

It's great when some outplay happens and they freak out. 

I also like how the analysts kinda jumped on the anti-Bjergsen train. He's overhyped imo, only performs well in NA.

Nothing has changed in LCS for years. Late game adcs are picked, early game junglers, tanky tops and late game mid laners. Then there is a strange agreement that none of the laners will ever attack each other for 20 minutes until somebody does a 4 man bot lane gank and mid game starts where everyone but top just looks for a misstep.

Well, there was that lane swap phase.
Which Riot quickly murdered.

I think stopwatch is preventing teams from trying too much early after the 6 minute mark as well. Hard to make an aggressive dive if the guy can go golden.

^This. Everyone gets their ults at around 6 minutes which just so happens to be when you get stopwatch so people don't want to go for plays when the enemy has that because it helps buy so much time. Look at the C9 vs GGS game and that early game action. Everyone and their fucking mother turned golden in the first fight XD

Except Stopwatch is used to juggle tower aggro too?

This doesn’t make sense

> [{quoted}](name=Spank the Fox,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=R0gaWhIK,comment-id=00260001,timestamp=2018-01-23T02:11:45.374+0000)
>
> Except Stopwatch is used to juggle tower aggro too?
> 
> This doesn’t make sense

It is more than just tower aggro. If you use stopwatch to dodge key cc and dmg, the enemies won't be able to stay under tower and continue the dive as most cc is not coming back in 2.5 seconds. Also, the delay stopwatch provides allows other players to crash towards the lane and add to a fight, making it very high risk to go after someone with a stopwatch.

My point is that you made it out to be a deterrent against dives, but it also enables dives to happen more often because statis will remove aggro, which is huge when you have minions for the tower to reset on.

Been like that for years. Hence why I never liked it. Occasionally you'd get one pro team being ballsy and doing some awesome aggressive plays but most of the time it is boring safety farm. 

Videogames just don't translate to fun to watch often for me. Though watching low tier games can be fun occasionally do to the lack of care/brawling and what not. 

Die esports die.

Plus as others said, only Asian teams take it seriously and dominate.

If the game wasn't so snowbally, there would be more action because the pros would actually be able to AFFORD a bad trade/bad fight and it wouldn't be over the second one of them gets first turret/first blood.
TCS was more enjoyable, the comedy added much to the experience

Ive been thinking this for such a long time. I cant  watch any kind of pro matches live. I have to watch re uploads so I can fast forward through the 15-20 minutes of early game boredom. They all just play so slow and never do any crazy picks, only super meta shit. Its like ever game follows a template, because they all play out almost the same pattern every time

"Games are too snowballing! Games decided at 10 minutes all because riot wants LC$ big bois plays" - the community
"Lcs is so boring laning phase lasts 20 minutes no action just farming" - also the community.

That's why you cant please everyone, and no, if the damage was low they wouldnt throw themselves at each other like silver players looking for kills.
I personally enjoy it for what it is, the casters are entertaining, the decisions are smart and it's a fun thing to watch at the background, but i never saw it as a main event stop everything LCS is starting!
If damage was lower they would have small skirmishes to poke down the enemy...

They still do, in c9 vs Clg game tristana and braum would constantly go in on varus and taric and do short trades.
Mid zilean vs mahlz was constant farm and poke.
Top was GP so he was poking every chance he had.
Rengar was counter jungling constantly fighting seju.

Skrimishes do happen, but they dont die unless someone commits hard because they know when to disengage and not just bash heads endlessly.

THank you perfect example of it was this game! Some of the others were very entertaining with small "almost fights" skirmishes like in 100t vs OPT. Pro players just know how not to turn skirmishes into full blown fights
I think it's good.
Last time I watched lcs was season 5, when {{champion:122}}  {{champion:114}}  and {{champion:41}}  were being played in worlds, while {{champion:82}}  was banned entire duration of the tournament.

They need to bring back catch up experience and buff towers. Giving away kills is something you cannot do at all now else you lose off the snowball alone. Last season it was possible to recover or even win from behind, that is not a possibility right now.

It's funny because Riot did this damage creep and no catch up experience for shorter games and now games are going 90+ minutes in pro play... the opposite of what was desired.

If everything is broken nothing is broken.

If you remove all of the slow and boring parts from the game, then it will be full of nothing but excitement right?
It only got really boring when they upped damage a few seasons ago. Players don't have small skirmishes anymore... Its just a "don't get inrange unless I can 100-0 the enemy"
It's been awful for at least the past 3 years, lol.

Stopped watching LCS since season 5 when tanks took over the game. If its wet noodle fight or tanks oneshotting everyone or tanks beating the best and skilled players on bruisers its all boring as fuck. Oh my god he bough double cloth armor on maokai! Yep X bought two longswords on riven so he is going to play safe now since Y has upper hand now!

 I mean what the fuck.
